New Records: Mitchell Marsh scored 177 not out, the 11th highest score in a successful ODI chase
Key Match Events: Mitchell Marsh's 177 not out led Australia to an eight-wicket win over Bangladesh
Marnus Labuschagne produced two run-outs to dismiss Mahmudullah and Najmul Hossain Shanto
Pre-Game Insights: Selectors might still have gone for two all-rounders, but Marcus Stoinis tweaked a calf
Mitchell Starc was rested against Bangladesh, having taken only early wickets in two of his eight games
Post-Match Reflections: Marsh had made a flying visit home to bid farewell to his grandfather and said 'I'm sure my nana and mum and all the family are watching at home, and hopefully it put a smile on their face'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Australia warm up for World Cup semi-finals with cruise past Bangladesh
Australia ended the group stage with seven wins in a row, but two imposing batting opponents could punish this tendency in the knockouts
Others: Marnus Labuschagne has grown in stature as a fielder during the tournament
Labuschagne has made himself one of Australia's most valuable fielders
